shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say
shorts.title_distilled: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, Pa. (WNEP) - Two women were killed and another was hospitalized from a machete attack in Pennsylvania. Police in Scranton said they are still investigating the machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn apartments on Tuesday night. Two women and a service d…

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud

shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Abington Heights’ defense stops Scranton
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Abington Heights’ defense stops Scranton.
shorts.description: SCRANTON — With its defense forcing Scranton into a tough shooting start, Abington Heights built a big halftime lead and went on to a 39-28 victory Monday night in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball matchup at Scranton High School. Emma Coleman scored 21 points for the second-ranked Lady Comets (3-0 league, 8-3 overall). Sarah Cantner added eight points and eight rebounds, while Sydney Pallman contributed six points and 10 rebounds. Chrissy Jacklinski led No. 5 Scranton (0-3, 3-8) with 12 points, nine rebounds, three assists and five steals. Rhylee Bell followed with nine points. “We tried a new […]
shorts.content: SCRANTON — With its defense forcing Scranton into a tough shooting start, Abington Heights built a big halftime lead and went on to a 39-28 victory Monday night in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball matchup at Scranton High School. Sarah Cantner added eight points and eight rebounds, while Sydney Pallman contributed six points and 10 rebounds. shorts.title: Clipboard, January 6, 2026
shorts.description: Lackawanna County Winter sowing workshop: Winter sowing hands-on workshop will be presented by Penn State Master Gardeners, Saturday, 10 a.m., community room at Nay Aug Park, 500 Arthur Ave., Scranton. The program is hosted by the Greenhouse Project. Participants will leave with perennial seeds planted in their own winter sowing containers. Register at 570-561-2113 or email dxk42@psu.edu. Bus trip: AARP NEPA Chapter 3731 will host a bus trip to the premiere showing of “Joshua” at the Sight and Sound Theatre in Lancaster County on May 29. Front-center seats; dinner afterward at the Bird in Hand Smorgasbord is included in the […]

shorts.title: NEPA Gives 2025 raised over $1.3 million
shorts.description: The board of governors of the Scranton Area Community Foundation show their support during NEPA Gives 2025, a record-breaking 24-hour giving event that united more than 8,000 donors in support of critical nonprofit work across the region. From left: attorney Jerry Musheno, R.Ph., Kenneth Okrepkie, Laura Ducceschi, Ellen Burkey, Patricia Fox, Psy.D., and Ryan McGowan.
shorts.content: The board of governors of the Scranton Area Community Foundation show their support during NEPA Gives 2025, a record-breaking 24-hour giving event that united more than 8,000 donors in support of critical nonprofit work across the region. From left: attorney Jerry Musheno, R.Ph., Kenneth Okrepkie, Laura Ducceschi, Ellen Burkey, Patricia Fox, Psy.D., and Ryan McGowan.
shorts.content_distilled: board of governors of the Scranton Area Community Foundation show their support during NEPA Gives 2025, a record-breaking 24-hour giving event that united more than 8,000 donors in support of critical nonprofit work across the region.

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: No. 1 Riverside, No. 4 Dunmore set for Division II showdown
shorts.description: Two of the dominant and most explosive teams in the Lackawanna League collide for the first of two meetings this week. Riverside (10-0 overall, 2-0 in division), the high-scoring and highly entertaining top-ranked team in The Times-Tribune High School Basketball Poll, hosts No. 4 Dunmore (9-1, 2-0) in a Division II showdown on Tuesday at 7:15 p.m. This matchup will feature the two most prolific scoring teams in the league, which sets the stage for an exciting game. Riverside has scored more than 60 points in nine of 10 games this season. They have a 97-point effort against Wyoming Valley […]
shorts.content: Two of the dominant and most explosive teams in the Lackawanna League collide for the first of two meetings this week. shorts.title: ATHLETE OF THE WEEK: Brayden Rose, Riverside basketball
shorts.title_distilled: ATHLETE OF THE WEEK: Brayden Rose, Riverside basketball.
shorts.description: The Riverside junior basketball player scored 58 points in two wins. He had 32 points and earned Taylor Lions Tournament MVP, as the Vikings defeated Lackawanna Trail, 86-59. Then, he scored 26 points in a 66-38 win over Mid Valley. Family: Mom, Kristyn; dad, Gerry; brother, Gerry; sister, Kayla. What do you think of how you’ve played recently: I thought it’s been a lot better. At the beginning, I wasn’t scoring as much as I would like to, so I just decided to step it up and get more aggressive and attacking the basket and it has proven to do […]
shorts.content: The Riverside junior basketball player scored 58 points in two wins. He had 32 points and earned Taylor Lions Tournament MVP, as the Vikings defeated Lackawanna Trail, 86-59. Then, he scored 26 points in a 66-38 win over Mid Valley. Family: Mom, Kristyn; dad, Gerry; brother, Gerry; sister, Kayla. What do you think of how you’ve played recently: I thought it’s been a lot better. At the beginning, I wasn’t scoring as much as I would like to, so I just decided to step it up and get more aggressive and attacking the basket and it has proven to do […]
shorts.content_distilled: Riverside junior basketball player scored 58 points in two wins.

shorts.title: NEPA Gives 2025 raised over $1.3 million
shorts.description: Scranton Area Community Foundation staff members gather at the foundation’s new headquarters inside the historic Century Club of Scranton to celebrate the success of NEPA Gives 2025, which raised over $1.3 million for 257 nonprofit organizations across Northeast Pennsylvania. Standing, from left: Jana Nelhybel, sustainability manager; Jacob Torba, philanthropy associate; Maggie Martinelli, chief operating officer; Cathy Fitzpatrick, director of grants and scholarships; Laura Ducceschi, president and CEO; Brad Reid, philanthropy manager; Brittany Pagnotti, director of donor relations and communications; Amy Betts, community impact manager; and Koren Clark, community impact manager. Seated: Dana Hunter, operations manager; Faith Schechter, NEPA Gives intern; […]
shorts.content: Scranton Area Community Foundation staff members gather at the foundation’s new headquarters inside the historic Century Club of Scranton to celebrate the success of NEPA Gives 2025, which raised over $1.3 million for 257 nonprofit organizations across Northeast Pennsylvania. Standing, from left: Jana Nelhybel, sustainability manager; Jacob Torba, philanthropy associate; Maggie Martinelli, chief operating officer; Cathy Fitzpatrick, director of grants and scholarships; Laura Ducceschi, president and CEO; Brad Reid, philanthropy manager; Brittany Pagnotti, director of donor relations and communications; Amy Betts, community impact manager; and Koren Clark, community impact manager. Seated: Dana Hunter, operations manager; Faith Schechter, NEPA Gives intern; […]
